What changes occur to the x-coordinate of the point $(8,8)$ when it is transformed by the function $y=\frac{1}{4}f(\frac{1}{2}x)$?
What changes occur to the y-coordinate of the point $(8,8)$ when it is transformed by the function $y=\frac{1}{4}f(\frac{1}{2}x)$?
Given these transformations and the fact that $(8,8)$ lies on the graph of $y=\frac{1}{4}f(\frac{1}{2}x)$, what point ($x', y'$) corresponds to the original function $y = f(x)$?
Calculate the sum of the coordinates of the point ($x', y'$) that must be on the graph of $y=f(x)$.
